greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest k such that (k^3 + 1)/(n^3 + 1) is an integer > 1.
comment: a(n) exists because n^3 + 1 divides (n^3 - n^2 + 1)^3 + 1. The set S of n such a(n) = n^3 - n^2 + 1 is S = (2, 3, 4, 7, 9, 15, 16, 19, 21, 22, ...).
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..300
program: (PARI) { for (n=1, 300, a=n + 1; while (frac((a^3 + 1)/(n^3 + 1)), a++); write("b065964.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Nov 04 2009
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Dec 08 2001
ext: Corrected and extended by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 11 2001
